definition[0]: a situation when you are almost in a new situation, usually a bad one
example[0]: In October 1962 the world seemed on the brink of nuclear war.
note[0]: on the brink of death/disaster/war etc
example[1]: The company had huge debts and was on the brink of collapse.
example[2]: managers who have taken their companies to the brink of disaster
example[3]: He will go down in history as the leader who pulled us back from the brink  (=saved us from disaster).
definition[1]: the edge of a very high place such as a cliff
